business.headline: Infosys agrees to pay $17.5 million to settle lawsuits over US cyber incidentInfosys first disclosed the cyber incident in a stock exchange filing in November 2023. The company said it was working with a cybersecurity products provider to resolve the issue and had launched an independent investigation to assess its impact.

Gold hits $3,000 for first time: Trade tensions and Fed bets drive rallyGold surged past $3,000 an ounce for the first time, driven by trade tensions, recession fears, and Fed rate cut bets. Analysts expect further gains, with prices potentially reaching $3,050 in 2025.

Mutual fund inflows at 10-month low: Here are 3 alternate investment optionsThe total assets under management (AUM) of the mutual fund industry fell 4%, from Rs 66.98 lakh crore in January to Rs 64.26 lakh crore in February.

Elon Musk's Tesla warns of tariff risks in letter to Trump administrationIn an unsigned letter to the Donald Trump-led administration, his ally Elon Musk's Tesla has cautioned that the US President's trade war could expose the automaker to retaliatory tariffs and increase the cost of making electric vehicles in America.
Tesla planning low-cost Model Y in China. Will India get it too?Production will take place at Tesla's Shanghai factory, its largest production hub, and mass production is expected to begin in 2026.
Intel shares jump 15% as investors welcome new CEO Lip-Bu TanIntel shares closed at $23.70, jumping 14.60% as investors placed their bet on the newly announced CEO.

Holi 2025 stock ideas: These 2 shares could deliver up to 16% gainsFor Holi 2025, Bajaj Broking has recommended two stocks that could see a 16% upside in the next 12 months amid a market correction that has seen Sensex and Nifty on a downward trend.

Sensex, Nifty outlook: Can domestic triggers lift market sentiment next week?Sensex dropped 200.85 points, closing at 73,828.91, while Nifty lost 73.30 points. The market remained volatile, with Nifty closing below 22,400 after fluctuating throughout the session.

Wall Street indices slip as Trump's EU tariff threat raises concernsAt the opening bell, the S&P 500 dipped 0.9 points, or 0.09%, at the open to 5,594.45​, the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 70.9 points, or 0.17%, at the open to 41,280.05 and Nasdaq Composite fell 49.9 points, or 0.28%, to 17,598.565.
Old share certificates in your drawer? Here's how you can encash themThe stock value of old shares can be calculated by multiplying the number of stocks held by the current market price.

Check SBI's latest lending rates for March 2025: MCLR and base rateThe updated MCLR rates will directly influence interest rates on various financial products, including home loans, personal loans, and other credit facilities offered by the bank.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market closed for Holi on March 14, 2025?Since there is some uncertainty over whether Holi 2025 falls on Friday or Saturday, it is important to check the official list of stock market holidays for clarity.

entertainment.headline: AR Rahman discharged from hospital, son shares health updateAR Rahman's son Ameen shared an update on the music maestro's health, explaining his hospitalisation was due to dehydration. He assured fans that Rahman is now recovering well. India Today Digital has learnt that the composer has also been discharged.

Watch: Actor Aamir Ali plays Holi with girlfriend Ankita KukretiTelevision actor Aamir Ali was seen celebrating Holi with his girlfriend Ankita Kukreti.  The couple's public appearance comes after Aamir confirmed his relationship status in a recent interview.

Ted Lasso returns: Jason Sudeikis show renewed for fourth seasonApple TV+ has renewed Ted Lasso for a fourth season with Jason Sudeikis leading the charge once more. The new season will introduce Ted coaching a women's football team.

Singer Shawn Mendes says 'dhanyawad' to India after Lollapalooza performanceSinger Shawn Mendes visited India for Lollapalooza 2025 and is currently in the nation, expressing his gratitude through social media post. He especially appreciated Mumbai.

Stand-up comic Zakir Khan treats Hasan Minhaj with delicious Indore foodZakir Khan hosted Hasan Minhaj in Indore, introducing him to the city's street food culture and hinting at a future collaboration.

Kim Soo-hyun removed as Prada's brand ambassador amid Kim Sae-ron scandal: ReportK-drama star Kim Soo-hyun has reportedly been removed as luxury brand Prada's brand ambassador following his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death scandal.

The Potato Lab review: Kang Tae-oh, Lee Sun-bin lead this quirky comedyReleased-Sat Mar 01, 2025The Potato Lab is a fun K-drama set in a picturesque mountain valley. While it offers laughs and visual appeal, it sometimes lacks depth and originality.

Exploring age gaps in K-dramas: Why do they cause so much buzz?K-dramas often feature age differences between lead actors, sparking debate among fans. While such gaps are common in real life, they draw more attention on screen. In this K-Fix, we will find out why do they matter so much.

Meghan Markle returns with podcast about successful women days after cooking showMeghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex, has announced her new stint. She will now be launching a podcast, narrating the stories of successful women.

Ashish Chanchlani celebrates Holi with director Abhishek KapoorAmid the India's Got Latent controversy, social media influencers Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija seemed to be moving forward in their respective journeys. Chanchlani stepped out to celebrate Holi, while Mukhija made her Instagram comeback, expressing gratitude to her fans.

Hema Malini seen with a 'script for reality show' on Indian Idol, fans reactA Reddit post suggested the scripted nature of Indian Idol as actor Hema Malini was seen holding a detailed script during a recent episode. The revelation has sparked reactions online, questioning the authenticity of reality shows.

K-drama star Lomon on Family Matters, Taj Mahal, India, All of Us are Dead | ExclusiveK-drama star Lomon sits down with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal to talk about his latest release, Family Matters, now streaming on Channel K. He has a special message for Indian fans as well.

Kim Soo-hyun's agency confirms he dated Kim Sae-ron, denies his role in her deathSouth Korean actor Kim Soo-hyun has been facing a lot of backlash for his alleged involvement in pushing his former girlfriend Kim Sae-ron to the brink of death. His agency has now clarified that the two were indeed dating.

Amitabh Bachchan confirms his KBC return amid retirement rumoursAmid speculation of Shah Rukh Khan or Aishwarya Rai hosting the next season of Kaun Banega Crorepati, Amitabh Bachchan has confirmed his return as the host. The veteran actor expressed gratitude for the love and support he received over the past 25 years.

Singer Shawn Mendes embraces Holi spirit in India, sends wishes to fansSinger Shawn Mendes is in India for Holi. The artiste, who recently performed at Lollapalooza India, extended his Holi wishes on Friday with a vibrant selfie.

Justin Bieber admits feeling 'unqualified, unequipped' in self-critical postSinger Justin Bieber opened up about his inner struggles and feelings of inadequacy amid ongoing health concerns, admitting to often feeling like a fraud despite his success.

Home studio to stardom: Arijit Singh, Martin Garrix unveil new singleSinger Arijit Singh and Dutch DJ and record producer, Martin Garrix, collaborated for a new single, 'Angels For Each Other'. The duo unveiled the song ahead of Holi. Garrix lent his vocals for the first time.

Kim Soo-hyun's co-star Seo Ye-ji on rumours of dating him: Please stopA recent controversy involving K-drama actor Kim Soo-hyun has dragged his former co-star Seo Ye-ji into the limelight. She addressed rumours linking her to the actor and expressed her frustration on her fancafe, clarifying that she has no personal ties with Kim Soo-hyun.

Liberal women like Ratna Pathak Shah often question sanskriti: Actor Rajesh KumarActor Ratna Pathak Shah's remarks on Karva Chauth in 2022 sparked a debate, leading to a response from her co-star Rajesh Kumar, who defended traditional customs.

general news.headline: US strikes on Yemen's Houthis kill 31, Trump warns 'Your time is up'Trump also issued a stern warning to Iran, the main supporter of the Houthis, demanding an immediate end to its backing of the group. He cautioned that any threat to the United States would have serious consequences.

Top LeT terrorist and Hafiz Saeed's trusted aide Abu Qatal killed in PakLashkar-e-Taiba's most wanted terrorist, Abu Qatal, was murdered in Pakistan on Saturday night. Qatal, a key operative of the terror outfit, was known for planning multiple attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.

AR Rahman discharged from hospital, son shares health updateAR Rahman's son Ameen shared an update on the music maestro's health, explaining his hospitalisation was due to dehydration. He assured fans that Rahman is now recovering well. India Today Digital has learnt that the composer has also been discharged.

Actor accuses 'drunk' co-star of molestation during Holi party: Said I love youA television actress has accused a fellow actor of harassment during a Holi celebration in Mumbai. The actress claimed the actor behaved inappropriately despite her objections.

Ropeway to Kedarnath: Will you take this Stairway to Heaven?Better connectivity due to a railway line and two cable car projects in Uttarakhand will help both tourists and locals, but it could forever change the essence of the pilgrimage experience to Kedarnath.

F1: McLaren's Norris wins Australian GP, Hamilton 10th in Ferrari debutLando Norris started the F1 2025 campaign in fine fashion as he fended off Max Verstappen to win the Australian GP on Sunday, March 16. The race, which was affected by rain, also saw Lewis Hamilton's poor weekend come to an end as he finished 10th on his Ferrari debut.

Nasa crew to relieve Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore arrives at Space StationNasa's Crew-10 mission docked at the ISS on Sunday at 9:40 AM IST, paving the way for Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore's long-awaited return. The SpaceX Dragon spacecraft arrived on an accelerated timeline to relieve the Crew-9 astronauts.

Elon Musk's Grok fires back with Hindi slang after X user tests it, triggers meme festAI chatbot Grok surprised the internet when it responded to a query using the exact Hindi slang used by the X user who had posted. The comments section was soon flooded with memes.

Don't want to sit alone and sulk: Kohli on BCCI's family restriction ruleVirat Kohli said that the presence of families on tours helps cricketers take responsibility for their game in a better way when they are going through tough times. Kohli was a part of India's Champions Trophy-winning squad.

Ranya Rao's father, DGP Ramachandra Rao, sent on compulsory leaveDays after Kannada actor Ranya Rao's arrest in a gold smuggling case, her stepfather, DGP Ramachandra Rao, has been placed on compulsory leave.

Telangana university bans protest on campus, BJP calls it 'undeclared emergency'The move by the university has drawn criticism from BRS and BJP.  Attacking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, BRS leader Krishank called the party "intolerant".

Nitin Gadkari rejects caste politics: Will kick those who talk about religionUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday rejected caste-based politics, emphasising that a person's worth is defined by their qualities, not identity. Speaking at a convocation in Nagpur, he vowed to uphold this principle, even at the cost of votes.

Floodlighting in a relationship is overwhelming. How to deal with it?Floodlighting is when someone overshares personal information just too soon. The term has been creating quite a buzz on social media lately.

Who is Lex Fridman? Meet the AI researcher hosting PM Modi's three-hour podcastLex Fridman, a Russian-born American AI researcher at MIT, is known for his work on human-robot interactions, AI ethics, robotics, and autonomous vehicles. He gained fame through his podcast featuring deep conversations with global figures.

Tornadoes rip through US leaving 27 dead; Missouri, Texas, Kansas hit hardestA series of powerful tornadoes and severe storms tore through the central United States, leaving at least 27 dead and causing widespread devastation, with homes destroyed, vehicles overturned, and thousands without power.

Amit Shah gifts guitar to Mizoram's 'wonder kid': Love for Bharat unites us allUnion Home Minister Amit Shah recognised the musical talent of Mizoram's seven-year-old 'wonder kid', Esther Lalduhawmi Hnamte, by gifting her a guitar after she captivated the audience with her soulful rendition of Vande Mataram song.

The Diplomat box office day 2: John Abraham's film witnesses growthJohn Abraham's latest film, The Diplomat, is gaining traction at the box office with a significant rise in earnings. The political thriller, directed by Shivam Nair, released on March 14.
Question Time: India Today News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Delhi-born Kamal Khera among 2 Indian-origin women in Mark Carney's cabinetIndo-Canadian Anita Anand and Delhi-born Kamal Khera have joined Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's cabinet. Anand is Minister of Innovation, Science, and Industry, while Khera serves as Minister of Health.

Divided by drama, united by colours: Bollywood's eternal Holi blendHindi cinema's love affair with Holi: Filmmakers have shown Holi on the screen for as long as Hindi cinema had existed. While at times, it has been shown as the juncture where love is professed, thus adding a new colour in the lives of the characters, at others it has been used as a backdrop for a crucial sequence to advance narratives. This cinematic Saturday, have a look at how Holi has been showcased through the years.

Nepali student's fiery speech on country's future goes viral. Video impresses InternetA video of a Nepali student delivering a fiery speech at a school event has gone viral on social media. The reason? His passionate tone as he speaks about the future of his country.

Toddler plays with snake as adults watch. Internet slams reckless behaviour in videoIn a now-viral video, a toddler casually handles a snake, even gripping it by the head and inspecting it closely while adults watch.

'Where is paltu chacha?' Tej Pratap's scooter ride outside Nitish Kumar's homeAfter celebrating Holi with party workers, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav rode a scooter to Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's residence, shouting, 'Where is Paltu Chacha?'.

'Who said reservation is only for Muslims?' DK Shivakumar on 4% tender quota rowKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar clarified that 4% reservation for contractors in government tenders applies to all minorities, not just Muslims.

Paramasivan Fathima trailer: Vemal's film explores religious conversions, conflictsThe trailer for Paramasivan Fathima, directed by Esakki Karvannan, was released on March 14. The film will highlight political and religious tensions in a small village.

Test promos: R Madhavan, Nayanthara play a couple fighting their own demonsThe character teasers of R Madhavan and Nayanthara from the upcoming Netflix film, Test, have been released. The film will release on April 4.

AR Rahman is fine, to be back home soon, MK Stalin shares health updateRenowned composer AR Rahman was admitted to a Chennai hospital due to neck pain. Now, MK Stalin has shared an update regarding the musician's health.

The Diplomat box office day 2: John Abraham's film witnesses growthJohn Abraham's latest film, The Diplomat, is gaining traction at the box office with a significant rise in earnings. The political thriller, directed by Shivam Nair, released on March 14.

sports.headline: F1: Landos Norris happy with winning start despite 'stressful' Australian GPLando Norris said he was happy to start the F1 2025 season with a win but admitted that the Australian GP was stressful for him. Norris was able to hold off Max Verstappen to secure the win on Sunday, March 16.

RCB's record chase, Nat Sciver-Brunt's dream run and more statsWPL 2025: The 22 matches in the Women's Premier League saw plenty of records being broken. The tournament came to a close with Mumbai Indians (MI) lifting the title for the second time at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai on Saturday.

F1: McLaren's Norris wins Australian GP, Hamilton 10th in Ferrari debutLando Norris started the F1 2025 campaign in fine fashion as he fended off Max Verstappen to win the Australian GP on Sunday, March 16. The race, which was affected by rain, also saw Lewis Hamilton's poor weekend come to an end as he finished 10th on his Ferrari debut.

Carlos Alcaraz's three-peat dream crashes in semis against Jack DraperIndian Wells Masters 2025: Jack Draper became the third player after Rafael Nadal and Andy Murray to beat Carlos Alcaraz when he won 6-1, 0-6, 6-4 in the semi-final on Saturday.

New-look Pakistan hammered in T20I series openerNZ vs PAK: New Zealand beat Pakistan by nine wickets in the series opener at the Hagley Oval to take a 1-0 lead in the series. Kyle Jamieson won the Player of the Match award with figures of 4-1-8-3.

Don't want to sit alone and sulk: Kohli on BCCI's family restriction ruleVirat Kohli said that the presence of families on tours helps cricketers take responsibility for their game in a better way when they are going through tough times. Kohli was a part of India's Champions Trophy-winning squad.

Pakistan slump to their lowest T20I total vs New Zealand in ChristchurchNZ vs PAK: Pakistan were bowled out for 91 in 18.4 overs, their lowest score against New Zealand in T20Is. For the first time, Pakistan were bowled out for a score of under 100 in a T20I against the Black Caps.

Not all fairytales have happy endings, some have agony. Ft. Meg LanningWPL 2025: Meg Lanning finished as the losing captain for the third time on the trot in the tournament after Mumbai Indians beat the Delhi Capitals by eight runs in the final on Saturday at the Brabourne Stadium.

Mumbai Indians win WPL crown after Harman special, Delhi crumble once againDelhi Capitals crumbled under pressure once again, losing their third title match in three seasons. MI captain Harmenpreet Kaur starred with a stunning 66-run knock as Mumbai won the summit clash by 8 runs.

Virat Kohli's dig at broadcasters: No need to discuss my favourite chhole bhatureVirat Kohli took a dig at the broadcasters at the RCB Innovation Lab Indian Sports Summit. Kohli said that the analysts should focus on cricket and not discuss what his favourite place to eat chhole bhature in Delhi was.

Pakistan slump to their lowest T20I total vs New Zealand in ChristchurchNZ vs PAK: Pakistan were bowled out for 91 in 18.4 overs, their lowest score against New Zealand in T20Is. For the first time, Pakistan were bowled out for a score of under 100 in a T20I against the Black Caps.

Not all fairytales have happy endings, some have agony. Ft. Meg LanningWPL 2025: Meg Lanning finished as the losing captain for the third time on the trot in the tournament after Mumbai Indians beat the Delhi Capitals by eight runs in the final on Saturday at the Brabourne Stadium.

Mumbai Indians win WPL crown after Harman special, Delhi crumble once againDelhi Capitals crumbled under pressure once again, losing their third title match in three seasons. MI captain Harmenpreet Kaur starred with a stunning 66-run knock as Mumbai won the summit clash by 8 runs.

Virat Kohli's dig at broadcasters: No need to discuss my favourite chhole bhatureVirat Kohli took a dig at the broadcasters at the RCB Innovation Lab Indian Sports Summit. Kohli said that the analysts should focus on cricket and not discuss what his favourite place to eat chhole bhature in Delhi was.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
